climbs.name: Welcome to War
climbs.fa: Chris Caldwell, Eddie Begoon, Jim MacArthur 1985

content.description: Same start as Rampage on the big ledge filled with briars; follow broken corner to large V-Shaped Flake, take the right flake/corner for about 20 feet, then follow right on the roto ledge to a finger crack (if you do not take the ledge and stay on the corner/flake, it is 5.10) Rappel from the tree at the top.
content.protection: Standard rack, long slings, 2 ropes to rap
content.location: Same ledge as routes 2-5. If you continue up and right from here, you might be able to find War Pig (5.7), Brothers in Arms (5.11c) or Semi- Warrior (5.10b)

content.description:
Two corner systems sandwiched by jugs and a crack.

Start in the orange corner (20 feet tall), move left on jugs to a ledge, then right on jugs and horns. Sling horns for pro. Head to the upper corner on good pro. Stay away from the obvious detached block on the left. Continue on a nice finger crack up high to anchors. Note: anchor was placed due to dead rap tree atop the cliff.
content.location: Far right side of the Orange Ledge, in an orange corner

content.description: The holds on the upper section of this one are incredible... ear-shaped dinner plate jugs and bizarre horns. The route is most easily founf by located the two bolts in the black wave 80 feet up.
content.location: Starts on the left side of the Orange Ledge at two triangular flakes that face each other. #3 cam protects the start off the exposed ledge.

content.description: Cool layback features, a few finger locks, and a few finger buckets. Start the same as Twenty Five to a ledge, move up and right on huge jugs, slinging horns for pro to a big flake. Move left at the big flake to a left leaning crack system. At bolt two, head straight up bouldery finger buckets (stay away from large block on your right). Shares anchors with Victory Corners.
content.location: Left side of the Orange Ledge.

climbs.name: Rampage
climbs.fa: Chris Caldwell, Eddie Begoon, Jim MacArthur 1985

content.description: Same start as Welcome to war; follow broken corner to V-Shaped Flake, take the right flake/corner for about 20 feet, then left following a left trending ramp (Welcome to War goes right here). Follow crimpy/lichen filled face to the top
content.protection: Rap from slings at the top, bring 2 ropes
content.location: Start on the same ledge as Battle of the Buldge and others

content.description:
Can be done in 1 or 2 (short) pitches. The first half is about 5.8. The upper half can be done via two variations (5.8 or 5.10-).

Climb jugs to a ledge below the bulge with a bolt. Move up to jug rail and right past cam placement to another bolt. Continue to ledge at ~ 50'. This section is about 5.8. The two options for the upper section are:

Left var. goes up crack to easy face and an anchor. 5.8-

Right var. is better and climbs the face to a short crack rail and a bolt at the lip (out of sight from below), then easy climbing to finish to same anchor. 5.10-

Rap or lower right at 100' -watch your rope.
content.location: On the far right side of the Laundry Room Prow, and ~ 100 feet left of the Thunderbird.

content.description: Start same as for Aces High but at end of short corner step up and right onto ledge system. Climb the blocky features up then right to gain the first bulge and bolt in the black streak). Pull the steep move and climb up past slung horns and gear for pro to the next bulge and bolt 2. Pull another steep move and gain the obtuse angled corner. Follow it past 2 bolts. Step left just above the second bolt here to get to the Aces High anchor (do not continue up and right to the anchor on "25").
content.location: just right of Aces High. Look for the black streak with a bolt about 40' up.

content.description: From the large ledge, climb up broken boulders and take the left part of the obvious V-shaped corner/flake. Follow this corner past a bolt to the summit. The top was a bit dirty
content.protection: One old bolt and standard NC rack.
content.location: Same as Rampage and Welcome to war

content.description:
This line climbs the face about 50' right of The Fabulous Thunderbird.

Start on a small grassy shelf below a short shallow corner and a small rhodo. Climb the corner past a brief section of junky rock to a hidden bolt in the left facing dihedral about 25' up. Climb the steep and funky wall past gear and bolts to a ledge around 90' up. Either belay here on hand size cams or place one as directional and move right to the anchor on Aces High. It is possible to lower with a 60m rope, just watch you ends.
content.protection: bolts and medium size rack of cams from 0.3 to #4 camalot.
content.location: Next route right of "The Fabulous Thunderbird". Look for the conspicuously large and round orange section of rock near the bottom.

content.protection: NC Trad rack, build your own anchors, walk right for rappel at rap anchors/slings or you may be able to scramble down to the left. Bring 2 ropes for the rap
content.location:
most left route on the wall. P1:The start is on a dirt pad and follows a small corner/weakness to a nice ledge.

P2: Follow corner to ledge

P3: follow path of least resistance (right-ish) to the top

climbs.name: Battle of the Bulge
climbs.fa: Chris Caldwell, Bruce Burgess, Buddy Price

content.description: Climb up and left, under a flake then wander up the face
content.protection: Rap from trees at the top. 2 ropes to get down
content.location: Walk right once you hit the rock, trending uphill. There will be a large ledge at the base of cliff. This route is the furthest left leaving from that ledge. Bring a machete for the briars at the base.

content.description: Start on a ledge about 25' right of The Fugitive by a small tree. Climb the easy corner up and left to gain some flakes below the bulge. Move up and then right under the bulge to a cool rock horn (sling this). Follow easier rock above up to the short seam. This leads to a line of 4 bolts and some excellent climbing through the headwall and onto a small ledge at the anchor.
content.location: climbs the tallest, most center portion of the main wall.
